intro: Ditmaria, commonly known as the fairy lantern or fairy cup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. The plants are characterized by their bell-shaped, often brightly colored flowers that bloom in late summer. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are often found in dry, open habitats. The genus is noted for its ornamental value due to its unique and colorful blooms.
